no.ntnu.okse.protocol

Interface ProtocolServer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractProtocolServer, AMQProtocolServer, CoreServiceTest.TestProtocol, DummyProtocolServer, WSNotificationServer

    public interface ProtocolServer
    Created by Aleksander Skraastad (myth) on 3/13/15.

    okse is licenced under the MIT licence.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void boot()
      This interface method must implement a complete initialization and startup process of a protocol server.
      java.lang.String getHost() 
      int getPort() 
      java.lang.String getProtocolServerType()
      This interface method must return a string with the name of the protocol for which the protocol server is responsible for handling.
      int getTotalBadRequests()
      This interface method must return the total amount of bad requests received by the protocol server.
      int getTotalErrors()
      This interface method must return the total amount of errors generated by the protocol server.
      int getTotalMessagesReceived()
      This interface method must return the total amount of messages that has been received by the protocol server.
      int getTotalMessagesSent()
      This interface method must return the total amount of messages that has been processed by the protocol server.
      int getTotalRequests()
      This interface method must return the total amount of requests the protocol server has handled.
      void run()
      This interface method should contain the main run loop initialization
      void sendMessage(Message message)
      This interface method must take in an instance of Message, which contains the appropriate references and flags needed to distribute the message to consumers.
      void stopServer()
      This interface method must implement a complete shutdown procedure of the protocol server.

    • Method Detail

      • getHost

        java.lang.String getHost()

      • getPort

        int getPort()

      • getTotalRequests

        int getTotalRequests()
        This interface method must return the total amount of requests the protocol server has handled.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the total amount of requests handled.

      • getTotalMessagesSent

        int getTotalMessagesSent()
        This interface method must return the total amount of messages that has been processed by the protocol server.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the total amount of sent messages.

      • getTotalMessagesReceived

        int getTotalMessagesReceived()
        This interface method must return the total amount of messages that has been received by the protocol server.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the total amount of received messages.

      • getTotalBadRequests

        int getTotalBadRequests()
        This interface method must return the total amount of bad requests received by the protocol server.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the total amount of received malformed or bad requests

      • getTotalErrors

        int getTotalErrors()
        This interface method must return the total amount of errors generated by the protocol server.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the total amount of errors in the protocol server.

      • boot

        void boot()
        This interface method must implement a complete initialization and startup process of a protocol server. As it is used in the Core Service to fire up all registered protocol servers upon application start.

      • run

        void run()
        This interface method should contain the main run loop initialization

      • stopServer

        void stopServer()
        This interface method must implement a complete shutdown procedure of the protocol server.

      • getProtocolServerType

        java.lang.String getProtocolServerType()
        This interface method must return a string with the name of the protocol for which the protocol server is responsible for handling.
        Returns:
        A string representing the name of the protocol in question.

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(Message message)
        This interface method must take in an instance of Message, which contains the appropriate references and flags needed to distribute the message to consumers. Implementation specific details can vary from protocol to protocol, but the end result of a method call to sendMessage is that the message is delivered, or an error is logged.
        Parameters:
        message - An instance of Message containing the required data to distribute a message.
